pullRequest.body:
I prove the existence of local flows of time-dependent vector fields. To do this, I refactor the current proof of the Picard-Lindelöf theorem to allow the initial point to be different from the point about which the hypotheses on the theorem are stated. This way, integral curves and flows are treated on equal footing. I also show that if the vector field is $C^n$, then its solution is also $C^n$.

The refactor is more of a rewrite, partly so that I understand the current proof and all its design choices. This is part of my effort to show that the solution to an ODE depends smoothly on the initial condition, or on parameters of the ODE. This is in turn needed for many results about manifolds, such as the fact that $C^1$ vector fields on compact manifolds always have global integral curves (or global flows).

I generalise the Prop structure `IsPicardLindelof`. Many of the proof steps are inspired by those in the current `ODE/PicardLindelof` file. Some changes in the refactor aim to build a good API, while others are conceptual simplifications, in my opinion.
* The `PicardLindelof` data structure is removed entirely. It merely bundles the non-Prop arguments into itself. Although it simplifies the assumptions in subsequent proofs, it obscures the (in)dependence on the relevant constants in the type description of theorems. Since `IsPicardLindelof` is already a public facing structure, we should also simply use it internally, without any loss.
* In particular, I remove the completely superficial dependence of `FunSpace` on the `PicardLindelof` structure.
* I avoid defining new non-Prop things that are only used in the proof steps, such as the current `vComp` and `tDist`. The proofs are a little longer as a result, but they are also more readable.
* I place all private (i.e. only internally used) theorems under the namespace `FunSpace`, to guide users to the proper theorems in the public API.

This is a work in progress. The definitions may change as further theory is formalised. In particular, I plan to remove the `initial` condition from `FunSpace`, as we would like to say, "this integral operator applied to a curve with initial point `x` will converge to a curve with initial point `y`," which is not currently possible due to the explicit type dependence of `FunSpace` on the initial point. This is necessary to show that the solution has Lipschitz continuous dependence on the initial point.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ abs_sub_le_max_sub`
`+ comp_projIcc_mem_closedBall`
`+ congr`
`+ contDiffOn_comp`
`+ contDiffOn_enat_Ioo_of_hasDerivAt`
`+ contDiffOn_enat_integrate_Ioo`
`+ contDiffOn_nat_integrate_Ioo`
`+ continuousOn_comp`
`+ continuousOn_comp_projIcc`
`+ continuousOn_uncurry`
`+ continuousOn_uncurry_of_lipschitzOnWith_continuousOn`
`+ dist_comp_iterate_next_le`
`+ exists_contractingWith_iterate_next`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivAt_Ioo_of_contDiffAt`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivAt_Ioo_of_contDiffAt₀`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivWithinAt`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivWithinAt_Icc_of_contDiffAt`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivWithinAt_Icc_of_contDiffAt₀`
`+ exists_eq_hasDerivWithinAt₀`
`+ exists_forall_mem_closedBall_eq_hasDerivAt_Ioo`
`+ exists_forall_mem_closedBall_eq_hasDerivWithinAt`
`+ exists_forall_mem_closedBall_eq_hasDerivWithinAt_Icc`
`+ exists_funSpace_integrate_eq`
`+ hasDerivAt_integrate_of_isOpen`
`+ hasDerivWithinAt_integrate_Icc`
`+ instance : CoeFun (FunSpace t₀ x L) fun _ ↦ Icc tmin tmax → E := ⟨fun α ↦ α.toFun⟩`
`+ instance : Inhabited (FunSpace t₀ x L)`
`+ instance : MetricSpace (FunSpace t₀ x L)`
`+ instance [CompleteSpace E] : CompleteSpace (FunSpace t₀ x L) := by`
`+ integrate`
`+ integrate_apply`
`+ integrate_eq_of_hasDerivAt`
`+ mk_of_contDiffOn_one`
`+ mk_of_contDiffOn_one'`
`+ mk_of_time_independent`
`- IsPicardLindelof.exists_forall_hasDerivWithinAt_Icc_eq`
`- IsPicardLindelof.norm_le₀`
`- PicardLindelof`
`- continuousOn`
`- continuous_proj`
`- continuous_vComp`
`- dist_apply_le_dist`
`- dist_le_of_forall`
`- dist_next_apply_le_of_le`
`- dist_t₀_le`
`- exists_contracting_iterate`
`- exists_fixed`
`- exists_forall_hasDerivAt_Ioo_eq_of_contDiff`
`- exists_forall_hasDerivAt_Ioo_eq_of_contDiffAt`
`- exists_isPicardLindelof_const_of_contDiffAt`
`- exists_solution`
`- for`
`- hasDerivWithinAt_next`
`- instance : CoeFun (FunSpace v) fun _ => Icc v.tMin v.tMax → E`
`- instance : CoeFun (PicardLindelof E) fun _ => ℝ → E → E`
`- instance : Inhabited (PicardLindelof E)`
`- instance : Inhabited v.FunSpace`
`- instance : MetricSpace v.FunSpace`
`- instance [CompleteSpace E] : CompleteSpace v.FunSpace := by`
`- intervalIntegrable_vComp`
`- lipschitz`
`- lipschitzOnWith`
`- map_t₀`
`- mem_closedBall`
`- nonempty_Icc`
`- norm_le`
`- norm_vComp_le`
`- proj`
`- proj_coe`
`- proj_of_mem`
`- tDist`
`- tDist_nonneg`
`- tMin_le_tMax`
`- uniformInducing_toContinuousMap`
`- vComp`
`- vComp_apply_coe`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

pullRequest.title: feat: existence of local flows
